children.html:
In this scene of popular adult animated series "Bojack Horseman", an indie film maker, "Kelsey Jannings",
        is showing to her customers the "innovative product placement" she has been producing for them. 
        This satirical scene represents the current trend of companies to build marketing campaigns around
        artistic or political content, in an attempt at fostering attachment by the millenial generation.

What's so innovative about this content is that it's not a commercial.
        [...]
        Our target demo responds poorly when they feel they're being advertised to,
        but they love stories that engage them on their level,
        utilizing themes of inclusivity as well as dunking on the olds.
